bug.summary: Serialization of a vector of vectors
bug.description:
Transferred from http://code.opencv.org/issues/4392 || Philipp Hasper on 2015-06-09 08:57 || Priority: Normal || Affected: branch 'master' (3.0-dev) || Category: None || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: Medium || PR: || Platform: Any / Any Serialization of a vector of vectors Serializing nested vectors using the persistence framework: 
std::vector > ppp;
ppp.push_back(std::vector(2)); ppp[0][0] = 2; ppp[0][1] = 2;
ppp.push_back(std::vector(3)); ppp[1][0] = 3; ppp[1][1] = 3;  ppp[1][2] = 3;
cv::FileStorage wfs("experiment.yml", cv::FileStorage::WRITE);
wfs << "points" << ppp;
wfs.release();
results in 
%YAML:1.0
points:
   - 2
   - 2
   - 3
   - 3
   - 3
which is obviously wrong - the two child vectors are just appended. A subsequent deserialization (@fs["points"] >> ppp@) will even crash. This is because the first, enclosing vector is written using "@void write( FileStorage& fs, const String& name, const std::vector<_Tp>& vec )@":https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/blob/424c2bddb39dae97dc4639a24eaa0e0c8fbb8e69/modules/core/include/opencv2/core/persistence.hpp#L981. But the child vectors are written using "@void write( FileStorage& fs, const std::vector<_Tp>& vec )@":https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/blob/424c2bddb39dae97dc4639a24eaa0e0c8fbb8e69/modules/core/include/opencv2/core/persistence.hpp#L917 which does not introduce a nested structure.
